conclusion: Ensure all light emitted by point light source inside glass sphere can pass through the sphere.
Light rays emitted by point light source must not exceed critical angle for total internal reflection at sphere boundary.
Identify critical angle for total internal reflection as theta_c = sin^(-1)(1/n).
Critical angle theta_c depends on refractive index n of glass sphere.
Determine maximum distance d from center O of sphere to light source S.
Angle of incidence alpha at sphere boundary must be less than critical angle theta_c for light to pass through.
Relate angle alpha to distance d and radius R of sphere using geometry.
In right triangle formed by radius OP and line segment OS, angle alpha is given by sin(alpha) = d/R.
For light to pass through sphere, sin(alpha) < sin(theta_c) implies d/R < 1/n implies d < R/n.
Position of point light source S must be such that its distance d from center O of sphere is less than R/n.
Condition for position of point light source S is d < R/n.
